questions.text: Which of the following correctly represents the effect of the mutation causing sickle cell anaemia?

options.label: A
options.text: Glutamate by valine at the 6th position

options.label: B
options.text: Valine by glutamate at the 6th position

options.label: C
options.text: Glutamate by valine at the 5th position

options.label: D
options.text: Valine by glutamate at the 5th position

questions.correct_answer: A. Glutamate by valine at the 6th position

questions.text: Match the following with the appropriate disorder. A. Autosomal recessive Kennedy disease B. Mitochondrial 2. Duchenne’s muscular dystrophy C. X-linked recessive 3. Leber’s disease D. Trinucleotide repeats 4. Cystic fibrosis
questions.explanation:
Autosomal recessive

Cystic fibrosis

Mitochondrial

Leber’s disease

X-linked recessive

Duchenne’s muscular dystrophy

Trinucleotide repeats

Kennedy disease

Autosomal Recessive Disorders

(Mnemonic: Pasta Fried Chawal/ Big Fax)
  • P- Phenylketonuria
  • A- Alkaptonuria
  • S- Sickle cell anaemia
  • Ta- Thalassemia
  • Fried- Friedreich's ataxia
  • C- Cystic Fibrosis
  • H- Hemophilia C, Homocystinuria, Hemochromatosis
  • A- Alpha 1 Antitrypsin Deficiency
  • W- Wilson Disease
  • A- Albinism, Congenital Adrenal Hyperplasia
  • L- Lysosomal Storage Disease, Glycogen Storage Disease
  • Big-Bloom syndrome
  • Fa- Fanconi anemia, Ataxia telangiectasia
  • X- Xeroderma pigmentosum

X-linked Recessive

(Mnemonic: WISE ABCDEFGH)
  • Wise-Wiskott Aldrich Syndrome
  • AB- Hemophilia A, B
  • B- Bruton's Hypogammaglobulinemia.
  • C- Chronic Granulomatous Disease, Red Green Color Blindness
  • D- DMD (Duchenne’s muscular dystrophy), BMD (Becker Muscular Dystrophy)
  • E- Lesch Nyhan Syndrome
  • F- Fabry Disease, Fragile X Syndrome
  • G- G6PD Deficiency
  • H- Hunter Disease

Trinucleate-Repeat Disorders
  • Fragile X Syndrome
  • Friedreich ataxia
  • Myotonic dystrophy
  • Spinobulbar muscular atrophy (Kennedy disease)
  • Dentatorubral-pallidoluysian atrophy (Haw River syndrome)
  • Spinocerebellar ataxia
  • Huntington disease

questions.text: B cells express IgM and IgD antibodies at the same time. Which phenomenon is it due to?

questions.explanation:
Prader-Willi syndrome

Chromosome 15q

SNORP gene
  • Paternal deletion
  • Maternal imprinting

Angelman syndrome

Chromosome 15q

UBE3A gene
  • Maternal deletion
  • Paternal imprinting

questions.text: Which of the following disorders is inherited in an X-linked dominant pattern?
questions.explanation:
Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Learning Objective:
  • ➤ X-linked dominance is more common in females. Affected males transmit the disease only to their daughters. Affected females transmit the disease to both daughters and sons.
  • ➤ X-linked dominance is more common in females.
  • ➤ Affected males transmit the disease only to their daughters.
  • ➤ Affected females transmit the disease to both daughters and sons.

questions.text: In cystic fibrosis, which of the following structures is affected in the pancreas?
questions.explanation:
Respiratory system

Gastrointestinal and hepatic

Others
  • Progressive airway obstruction
  • Infective exacerbations of bronchiectasis
  • Respiratory failure
  • Spontaneous pneumothorax
  • Haemoptysis
  • Lobar collapse due to secretions
  • Pulmonary hypertension
  • Nasal polyps
  • Malabsorption and steatorrhoea
  • Distal intestinal obstruction syndrome
  • Biliary cirrhosis
  • Portal hypertension, varices, and splenomegaly
  • Gallstones
  • Diabetes
  • Delayed puberty,
  • Male infertility
  • Stress incontinence due to repeated forced cough
  • Psychosocial problems
  • Osteoporosis
  • Arthropathy
  • Cutaneous vasculitis

questions.text: Premature ageing in Werner syndrome is due to:

options.label: C
options.text: Increase in length of telomere due to decrease in telomerase activity

(WISE ABCDEFGH)

questions.text: What is the diagnosis of a 14-year-old child who has short stature, widely placed nipples, and primary amenorrhea?
Which of the following is the mode of inheritance in a patient suffering from red-green colour blindness?
questions.explanation: Correct Option D - X-linked recessiv

questions.text: t(11,22) is best diagnosed by …………..

Match the columns A. Autosomal dominant 1. Duchenne muscular dystrophy B. X-linked recessive 2. Leber hereditary optic neuropathy C. Autosomal recessive 3. Cystic fibrosis D. Mitochondrial 4. Myotonic dystrophy
questions.explanation:
Autosomal dominant

Myotonic dystrophy

X-linked recessive

Duchenne muscular dystrophy

Autosomal recessive

Cystic fibrosis

Mitochondrial

Leber hereditary optic neuropathy

Modes of inheritance

Mode of Inheritance

Pedigree

Explanation

Diseases

Autosomal Dominant

  • Vertical transmission
  • Affected individuals in every generation
  • Male-to-male transmission
  • Equal male: female ratio
  • Huntington's disease
  • Marfan syndrome
  • Neurofibromatosis type
  • Myotonic dystrophy

 

 

Autosomal Recessive

  • Horizontal transmission
  • Skips generations
  • Consanguinity often seen
  • Equal male: female ratio
  • Cystic fibrosis
  • Sickle cell anemia
  • Beta-thalassemia

 

X-Linked Dominant

 

 

  • No male-to-male transmission
  • Affected fathers pass the trait to all daughters
  • More severely affected males.

 
  • Orofaciodigital syndrome.
  • Incontinentia Pigmenti
  • Vitamin D-resistant rickets.

 

X-Linked Recessive

  • Primarily affects males.
  • No male-to-male transmission.
  • Unaffected carrier females.
  • Hemophilia A.
  • Duchenne muscular dystrophy.
  • Hunter Syndrome.

 

Mitochondrial (Option D)

  • Maternal transmission only.
  • Both sexes can be affected.
  • All offspring of the affected mother are affected.
  • Leigh Disease.
  • MELAS syndrome.
  • Leber hereditary optic neuropathy.

questions.text: Which of the following is true regarding the Mendelian mode of inheritance?

options.label: A
options.text: 2/3 rd of Mendelian disorders are autosomal dominant

options.label: B
options.text: 1/3rd of Mendelian disorders are autosomal recessive

options.label: C
options.text: Every 5 th patient has an X-linked recessive disorder

options.label: D
options.text: Every 10 th patient has a Y-linked disorder

questions.correct_answer: A. 2/3 rd of Mendelian disorders are autosomal dominant
questions.explanation:
• 65% of mendelian disorders are autosomal dominant
  • 25% are autosomal recessive (Option B)
  • 5% are X-linked (Option C)

questions.text: Which of the following is true about Turner syndrome ?

options.label: A
options.text: Webbing of hands and toes are associated with risk of visceral anomalies

options.label: B
options.text: Noonan syndrome is more associated with cardiac defects

options.label: C
options.text: Absence of neck webbing is associated with higher risk of co-arctation of aorta

options.label: D
options.text: Webbing of neck is associated with higher risk of cardiac anomalies

questions.correct_answer: D. Webbing of neck is associated with higher risk of cardiac anomalies
questions.explanation: Correct Option D - Webbing of neck is associated with higher risk of cardiac

questions.text: An affected male does not have affected children, but an affected female always has affected children. What is the type of inheritance?
questions.explanation: Correct Option D - Mitoch

questions.text: With which pattern of disease inheritance is consanguinity associated?
questions.explanation: Correct Option A - Autosomal Recessiv

questions.text: Which of the following diseases has an X-linked recessive pattern of inheritance?
questions.explanation: Correct Option D - G6PD D

questions.text: Which chromosome is involved in myotonic dystrophy?
questions.explanation: Correct Option A - Chromosome 19

questions.text: Which of the following diseases is most commonly associated with Down syndrome?

questions.text: Alpha-1 antitrypsin is the major inhibitor of which enzyme ?
questions.explanation: Correct Option C - E

questions.text: All of the following are features of fragile X syndrome, except :
questions.explanation: Correct Option C - Microorch

questions.text: A boy was diagnosed with a medical condition that is believed to have been passed down from his grandmother to his father, and now to him. What is the pattern of inheritance in this case ?
questions.explanation: Correct Option C - Autosomal D
